back_cards.definition_en: To help someone with a task or activity
back_cards.example_en: She assisted her friend in moving to a new apartment.

back_cards.definition_en: To support in a professional setting
back_cards.example_en: The nurse assisted the doctor during the surgery.

back_cards.definition_en: To aid in achieving a goal
back_cards.example_en: Volunteers assisted in cleaning up the park after the storm.
The IT team assisted users with software installation.

back_cards.definition_en: To contribute to a team effort
back_cards.example_en: He assisted his colleagues in preparing the project presentation.

back_cards.definition_en: A derogatory term for a mean or unpleasant woman
back_cards.example_en: She called her coworker a bitch after a heated argument.
The farmer's bitch had a litter of puppies.
He was having a bitch about the long wait at the restaurant.

back_cards.definition_en: A term used to describe something difficult or unpleasant
back_cards.example_en: Fixing the old car was a real bitch of a job.

back_cards.definition_en: A casual term among friends, often not offensive
back_cards.example_en: She's my favorite bitch to hang out with on weekends.
The constant noise from the street kept her awake.
He maintained a constant speed while driving.
Her constant studying led to excellent grades.
The team faced constant challenges during the project.
The scientist recorded a constant temperature in the lab.
The teacher permitted extra time for the exam.
The city permitted the construction of a new building.
The weather permitted a picnic in the park.

back_cards.definition_en: To give consent for an activity
back_cards.example_en: Her parents permitted her to attend the concert.

back_cards.definition_en: To approve formally, as in regulations
back_cards.example_en: The law permits smoking in designated areas only.
The event was primarily organized for charity.
She works primarily from home to save time.

back_cards.definition_en: In the first place or originally
back_cards.example_en: The company was primarily founded to sell books.
The course is primarily designed for beginners.
The museum is primarily focused on modern art.

back_cards.definition_en: Activity that provides enjoyment or amusement
back_cards.example_en: The festival offered live music as entertainment.

back_cards.definition_en: A performance or show for an audience
back_cards.example_en: The theater hosted a comedy show for evening entertainment.
Streaming services provide endless entertainment options.
She organized a dinner party for the guests' entertainment.

back_cards.definition_en: A source of fun in daily life
back_cards.example_en: Playing board games is their favorite family entertainment.

back_cards.definition_en: To speak or call out loudly
back_cards.example_en: He shouted for help when he got lost.
The crowd shouted with joy when their team scored.

back_cards.definition_en: To communicate in a noisy environment
back_cards.example_en: She shouted to be heard over the loud music.
The teacher shouted to stop the students from running.
Fans shouted the player's name during the game.
She enrolled in a music academy to learn piano.

back_cards.definition_en: An organization for academic or professional study
back_cards.example_en: The academy published a journal on scientific research.
He graduated from a military academy with honors.

back_cards.definition_en: A group promoting arts or sciences
back_cards.example_en: The film academy awards prizes every year.
The coding academy offers courses for beginners.

back_cards.definition_en: A small spoon used for measuring or eating
back_cards.example_en: Add one teaspoon of sugar to the recipe.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit of measurement in cooking
back_cards.example_en: The recipe calls for two teaspoons of vanilla.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool for mixing small quantities
back_cards.example_en: She stirred her coffee with a teaspoon.
He used a teaspoon to eat his yogurt.
The chef measured salt with a teaspoon for accuracy.

back_cards.definition_en: To move something from one place to another
back_cards.example_en: She transferred the files to a new computer.
He transferred to a different university last year.
I transferred $100 to my savings account.

back_cards.definition_en: To relocate in a professional setting
back_cards.example_en: The company transferred her to the London office.

back_cards.definition_en: To pass responsibility to someone else
back_cards.example_en: The manager transferred the project to a new team.
She ordered her usual coffee at the caf√©.
He took his usual route to work.
The meeting followed its usual schedule.
They had their usual chat at the park.
The store had its usual crowd on weekends.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or group supporting another
back_cards.example_en: She was a loyal ally during the tough times.

back_cards.definition_en: A country in a formal alliance
back_cards.example_en: The two nations became allies in the treaty.

back_cards.definition_en: A partner in a cause or project
back_cards.example_en: He found an ally in his coworker for the proposal.

back_cards.definition_en: A supporter in a social movement
back_cards.example_en: She was an ally for environmental conservation.
He became her ally in planning the event.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to medical treatment or observation
back_cards.example_en: The doctor conducted a clinical examination of the patient.
Her clinical analysis of the data was precise.
The hospital uses clinical guidelines for treatment.
The study was conducted in a clinical manner.
She gained clinical experience during her internship.

back_cards.definition_en: To use offensive or vulgar language
back_cards.example_en: He swore loudly when he stubbed his toe.
She swore to tell the truth in court.
They swore to protect their community.
The driver swore at the traffic jam.
He swore to never give up on his dreams.

back_cards.definition_en: A wide street in a city
back_cards.example_en: They walked down the avenue lined with shops.

back_cards.definition_en: A pathway or approach to something
back_cards.example_en: She explored every avenue to find a job.
The avenue to the park was beautiful in fall.

back_cards.definition_en: A route to achieve a goal
back_cards.example_en: Volunteering was an avenue to meet new people.

back_cards.definition_en: A main road in an urban area
back_cards.example_en: The parade marched down the main avenue.

back_cards.definition_en: A religious leader in a church
back_cards.example_en: The priest delivered a sermon on Sunday.

back_cards.definition_en: A spiritual guide in a community
back_cards.example_en: The priest visited families to offer support.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who conducts religious ceremonies
back_cards.example_en: The priest officiated the wedding ceremony.

back_cards.definition_en: A clergy member in a specific faith
back_cards.example_en: The priest led prayers at the temple.
He turned to the priest for advice during a crisis.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of having a paid job
back_cards.example_en: She found employment at a local store.
The company announced new employment opportunities.
His employment as a teacher was rewarding.
The project required the employment of advanced technology.

back_cards.definition_en: A job in a professional field
back_cards.example_en: She sought employment in the tech industry.

back_cards.definition_en: To rest or become less tense
back_cards.example_en: She relaxed on the couch after a long day.
He relaxed his muscles after the workout.

back_cards.definition_en: To unwind in a social setting
back_cards.example_en: They relaxed with friends at a barbecue.
The school relaxed its dress code policy.
Listening to music helps her relax before bed.

back_cards.definition_en: To be in debt for money
back_cards.example_en: He owes $50 to his friend for dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: To have an obligation to repay
back_cards.example_en: She owes her success to hard work.

back_cards.definition_en: To be indebted for a favor
back_cards.example_en: I owe you a thank-you for your help.
He felt he owed his parents an apology.

back_cards.definition_en: To be required to give back
back_cards.example_en: They owe the bank a monthly payment.

back_cards.definition_en: To change significantly in form or appearance
back_cards.example_en: The renovation transformed the old house.

back_cards.definition_en: To alter in function or nature
back_cards.example_en: Her speech transformed the audience's perspective.
The company transformed its website for better use.

back_cards.definition_en: To shift in behavior or attitude
back_cards.example_en: He transformed into a more confident person.

back_cards.definition_en: To convert for a new purpose
back_cards.example_en: They transformed the garage into a studio.

back_cards.definition_en: A green plant covering lawns or fields
back_cards.example_en: The grass in the park was freshly mowed.
The kids played soccer on the grass.

back_cards.definition_en: A natural ground cover in nature
back_cards.example_en: The deer grazed on the grass in the meadow.

back_cards.definition_en: A lawn in a residential area
back_cards.example_en: He watered the grass to keep it green.
Some people use grass as a recreational drug.
The narrow path led to the village.
She has a narrow view of the issue.
They escaped by a narrow margin.
The narrow hallway was hard to navigate.
His research has a narrow focus on biology.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to a specific cultural group
back_cards.example_en: The festival celebrated ethnic traditions.

back_cards.definition_en: Associated with racial or national identity
back_cards.example_en: She wore an ethnic dress from her homeland.
The city has a rich ethnic diversity.
The restaurant serves ethnic cuisine.
The market sold ethnic crafts and jewelry.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who studies or researches
back_cards.example_en: The scholar wrote a book on ancient history.
She is a respected scholar in physics.
He was a scholar at the university.

back_cards.definition_en: A learned person in a field
back_cards.example_en: The scholar gave a lecture on literature.

back_cards.definition_en: A researcher in a specific discipline
back_cards.example_en: The scholar analyzed medieval texts.

back_cards.definition_en: A version of a published book
back_cards.example_en: She bought the latest edition of the novel.

back_cards.definition_en: A specific issue of a magazine
back_cards.example_en: The magazine's holiday edition was popular.

back_cards.definition_en: A particular version of a product
back_cards.example_en: The software's new edition has more features.
The evening news edition covered the storm.
The textbook's second edition was released.
They had to abandon their car in the flood.

back_cards.definition_en: To give up on an idea or plan
back_cards.example_en: She abandoned her dream of becoming an actor.

back_cards.definition_en: To desert a person or duty
back_cards.example_en: He abandoned his responsibilities at work.
The group abandoned the project due to costs.
The villagers abandoned the town after the disaster.

back_cards.definition_en: Useful or effective in real situations
back_cards.example_en: She gave practical advice for saving money.
The course offers practical training in coding.
His practical approach solved the problem quickly.
The bag is practical for carrying books.

back_cards.definition_en: Concerned with doing rather than theory
back_cards.example_en: The workshop teaches practical skills for repairs.

back_cards.definition_en: A disease caused by germs or bacteria
back_cards.example_en: The cut led to a skin infection.

back_cards.definition_en: The spread of a harmful microorganism
back_cards.example_en: The hospital prevented the infection from spreading.
She recovered from a lung infection.
The water source caused an infection outbreak.
The doctor treated her ear infection.
The musical performance was breathtaking.
Her voice had a musical quality.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving a theatrical performance with songs
back_cards.example_en: They watched a musical at the theater.
He plays a musical role in the band.
The musical rhythm of the poem was soothing.
Her suggestion to meet early was helpful.
The teacher gave a suggestion for improving the essay.
There was a suggestion of rain in the forecast.
His suggestion fixed the scheduling issue.

back_cards.definition_en: An idea shared in a discussion
back_cards.example_en: She made a suggestion during the team meeting.
The group showed resistance to the new policy.
The soldiers faced strong resistance from the enemy.
The bacteria developed resistance to antibiotics.
There was resistance to the new software update.
The cyclist battled wind resistance on the hill.
Smoke rose from the campfire.
He stepped outside for a quick smoke.

back_cards.definition_en: A cloud of particles in the air
back_cards.example_en: The factory emitted thick smoke.
Smoke from the wildfire covered the town.

back_cards.definition_en: A slang term for smoking something
back_cards.example_en: They gathered to have a smoke after work.

back_cards.definition_en: A male member of a royal family
back_cards.example_en: The prince attended the royal ceremony.

back_cards.definition_en: A ruler of a small state
back_cards.example_en: The prince governed the small kingdom.
The prince hosted a grand ball.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for an admirable man
back_cards.example_en: He was a prince among his peers.
The young prince prepared for his future role.
She stayed home due to a sudden illness.
The doctor diagnosed a chronic illness.
His illness lasted for two weeks.
The illness required immediate treatment.

back_cards.definition_en: A general term for being sick
back_cards.example_en: The flu is a common illness in winter.
She embraced her friend after a long time.

back_cards.definition_en: To accept or adopt an idea
back_cards.example_en: He embraced the new technology quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: To take up a cause or belief
back_cards.example_en: They embraced the movement for change.
The festival embraces diverse cultures.

back_cards.definition_en: To hold closely in a relationship
back_cards.example_en: She embraced her role as a mentor.

back_cards.definition_en: A country governed by elected officials
back_cards.example_en: The republic held elections every four years.

back_cards.definition_en: A system of government without a monarchy
back_cards.example_en: The nation became a republic after the revolution.
The republic passed new laws for equality.
The republic united for economic growth.
Citizens of the republic voted on the policy.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who offers to help without pay
back_cards.example_en: The volunteer cleaned up the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who joins a cause willingly
back_cards.example_en: She was a volunteer at the animal shelter.
The volunteer helped serve food at the event.

back_cards.definition_en: A person assisting in an organization
back_cards.example_en: He became a volunteer for the charity.
Volunteers supported the local library's program.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of assessing or judging
back_cards.example_en: The teacher completed the student's evaluation.

back_cards.definition_en: A review of performance or quality
back_cards.example_en: The company conducted an employee evaluation.
The evaluation of the project showed success.
The evaluation of the house set its price.
The program underwent a thorough evaluation.
They have opposite opinions on the topic.
The store is on the opposite side of the street.
The teams took opposite sides in the debate.
She turned in the opposite direction.
His calm demeanor was the opposite of hers.
The concert was absolutely awesome.
The mountain view was truly awesome.
She did an awesome job on the presentation.
That party was so awesome last night.
His new skateboard is totally awesome.
